00026 #ifndef SDBX_TREE_ITEM_H
00027 #define SDBX_TREE_ITEM_H
00028 
00029 
00030 // definition of an node item
00031 template <typename _KeyType, typename _IdType>
00032 struct TreeNodeItem  {
00033         
00034         typedef _KeyType                        KeyType;
00035         typedef _IdType                         IdType;
00036 
00037         KeyType                 key;
00038         IdType                  id;
00039         
00041         explicit TreeNodeItem(const KeyType &k)
00042                 : key(k)
00043         {}
00044 
00046         explicit TreeNodeItem(const KeyType &k, const IdType &i)
00047                 : key(k), id(i)
00048         {}
00049 
00050         TreeNodeItem(){}
00051         
00053         enum { 
00054                 record_size = record<KeyType>::size + record<IdType>::size,
00055                 id_offset = record<KeyType>::size
00056         };
00057         
00059         explicit TreeNodeItem(const unsigned char * const buffer) :
00060                 key(record<KeyType>::deserialize(buffer)),
00061                 id(record<IdType>::deserialize(buffer + id_offset))
00062         {}
00063         
00065         void Serialize(unsigned char * buffer) const
00066         {
00067                 record<KeyType>::serialize(key, buffer);
00068                 record<IdType>::serialize(id, buffer + id_offset);
00069         }
00070                 
00071         // gratuitious operators. I love templates.. :p
00072         template <typename ItemWithKey>
00073         bool operator < (const ItemWithKey &item) const { return key < item.key; }
00074         template <typename ItemWithKey>
00075         bool operator <=(const ItemWithKey &item) const { return key <=item.key; }
00076         template <typename ItemWithKey>
00077         bool operator > (const ItemWithKey &item) const { return key > item.key; }
00078         template <typename ItemWithKey>
00079         bool operator >=(const ItemWithKey &item) const { return key >=item.key; }
00080         template <typename ItemWithKey>
00081         bool operator ==(const ItemWithKey &item) const { return key ==item.key; }
00082         template <typename ItemWithKey>
00083         bool operator !=(const ItemWithKey &item) const { return key !=item.key; }
00084 };
00085 
00086 // definition of a leaf item -- pretty much the same as a node item,
00087 // except the names are changed
00088 template <typename _KeyType, typename _ValueType>
00089 struct TreeLeafItem  {
00090         
00091         typedef _KeyType                        KeyType;
00092         typedef _ValueType                      ValueType;
00093 
00094         KeyType                 key;
00095         ValueType               value;
00096         
00098         explicit TreeLeafItem(const KeyType &k, const ValueType &v)
00099                 : key(k), value(v)
00100         {}
00101         
00103         enum { 
00104                 record_size = record<KeyType>::size + record<ValueType>::size,
00105                 value_offset = record<KeyType>::size
00106         };
00107         
00109         explicit TreeLeafItem(const unsigned char * const buffer) :
00110                 key(record<KeyType>::deserialize(buffer)),
00111                 value(record<ValueType>::deserialize(buffer + value_offset))
00112         {}
00113         
00115         void Serialize(unsigned char * buffer) const
00116         {
00117                 record<KeyType>::serialize(key, buffer);
00118                 record<ValueType>::serialize(value, buffer + value_offset);
00119         }
00120         
00121         // gratuitious operators. I love templates.. :p
00122         template <typename ItemWithKey>
00123         bool operator < (const ItemWithKey &item) const { return key < item.key; }
00124         template <typename ItemWithKey>
00125         bool operator <=(const ItemWithKey &item) const { return key <=item.key; }
00126         template <typename ItemWithKey>
00127         bool operator > (const ItemWithKey &item) const { return key > item.key; }
00128         template <typename ItemWithKey>
00129         bool operator >=(const ItemWithKey &item) const { return key >=item.key; }
00130         template <typename ItemWithKey>
00131         bool operator ==(const ItemWithKey &item) const { return key ==item.key; }
00132         template <typename ItemWithKey>
00133         bool operator !=(const ItemWithKey &item) const { return key !=item.key; }
00134 };
